alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern DeKalb County through 800 PM CDT... At 742 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Payne, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Payne, Pine Ridge, Lebanon, Dog Town, Collbran, Adamsburg and Little River Canyon NP. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
